About.title: Interactive Mental Health
About.p1: Mentally is a Mental Health Support System which is a 24/7 AI-powered platform designed to provide personalized mental health support.
About.p2: It uses advanced technologies such as sentiment analysis and smart chatbots to analyze emotions and offer tailored recommendations.
About.p3: The platform also provides users with tools like meditation exercises, group therapy and mental health progress tracking for holistic emotional well-being.

AI-powered analysis.title: AI-powered analysis

Chatbot.title: start your journey to better mental health
Chatbot.description: Take the first step towards a healthier mind with our interactive platform.

data.question: How does the AI analysis work?
data.answer: Our AI system uses advanced natural language processing to analyze your responses and emotional patterns, providing personalized support and recommendations based on your unique situation.

data.question: Are the group therapy sessions confidential?
data.answer: Yes, all group therapy sessions are completely confidential and moderated by licensed professionals. We maintain strict privacy standards to ensure a safe space for all participants.

data.question: How often should I use the platform?
data.answer: We recommend regular check-ins, ideally daily or weekly, to get the most benefit from the platform. However, you can use it as frequently as you need based on your personal circumstances.

data.question: Can I track my progress over time?
data.answer: Yes, our platform provides detailed progress tracking through personalized insights, charts, and regular assessment reports to help you monitor your mental health journey.

data.quote: This platform has transformed how I manage my mental health. The AI analysis is incredibly accurate.
data.author: Sarah M.

data.quote: The group therapy sessions have given me a supportive community I never knew I needed.
data.author: Michael R.

data.quote: The personalized insights helped me understand my patterns and make positive changes.
data.author: Emma L.

Assessments.title: mental health assessments
Assessments.description: Explore our range of mental health tests to gain further insights into your well-being.

data.title: depression
questions: Do you feel sad or depressed most of the time?
Have you lost interest in activities you used to enjoy?
Do you experience changes in appetite (increase or decrease)?
Do you have trouble sleeping or sleep more than usual?
Do you feel tired or lack energy daily?
Do you feel guilty or worthless?
Do you find it hard to concentrate or make decisions?
Do you have thoughts about death or suicide?
Do you feel isolated from others?
Do you feel hopeless or lack hope for the future?

data.title: anxiety
questions: Do you feel anxious or worried most of the time?
Do you find it hard to control your worries?
Do you feel easily annoyed or irritable?
Do you experience racing heart or shortness of breath?
Do you have trouble sleeping due to overthinking?
Do you experience physical pain (like headaches) due to anxiety?
Do you feel afraid of social situations?
Do you have sudden panic attacks?
Do you avoid places or people because of anxiety?
Do you feel that something bad is always going to happen?

data.title: adhd
questions: Do you find it hard to stay focused on tasks?
Do you often lose things needed for daily activities?
Do you feel restless or fidgety most of the time?
Do you interrupt others during conversations?
Do you struggle to follow through on instructions?
Do you have trouble organizing tasks or activities?
Do you avoid tasks that require sustained mental effort?
Are you easily distracted by external stimuli?
Do you forget daily responsibilities or appointments?
Do you feel impatient or have trouble waiting your turn?

data.title: ptsd
questions: Do you have recurring memories of a traumatic event?
Do you experience nightmares about a past trauma?
Do you avoid reminders of a traumatic event?
Do you feel on edge or easily startled?
Do you have trouble sleeping due to past events?
Do you feel detached from others since the trauma?
Do you experience flashbacks of the event?
Do you feel guilty or blame yourself for the trauma?
Do you have negative thoughts about the world?
Do you lose interest in activities since the trauma?

data.title: addiction
questions: Do you feel unable to stop using a substance or behavior?
Do you need more of it to feel the same effect?
Do you experience withdrawal symptoms when stopping?
Do you spend a lot of time obtaining or using it?
Do you neglect responsibilities due to this habit?
Do you continue despite negative consequences?
Do you hide your usage from others?
Do you feel anxious when you can't use it?
Do you lose interest in other activities?
Do you prioritize it over relationships?

data.title: bipolar
questions: Do you experience extreme mood swings (highs and lows)?
Have you had periods of unusually high energy?
Do you feel depressed for days or weeks at a time?
Do you engage in risky behaviors during high-energy periods?
Do you have trouble sleeping during energetic phases?
Do you feel worthless during low periods?
Do you talk faster than usual during high moods?
Do you lose interest in activities during low moods?
Do you have racing thoughts during high-energy times?
Do you feel hopeless during depressive episodes?

data.title: eating disorder
questions: Do you worry excessively about your weight or shape?
Do you skip meals or restrict food intake?
Do you feel guilty after eating?
Do you binge eat and feel out of control?
Do you exercise excessively to control weight?
Do you use laxatives or vomiting to control weight?
Do you feel your self-worth depends on your weight?
Do you avoid eating in front of others?
Do you have irregular eating patterns?
Do you obsess over calories or food content?

data.title: parent
questions: Does your child seem unusually sad or withdrawn?
Does your child have trouble sleeping or eating?
Does your child show extreme mood swings?
Does your child avoid social interactions?
Does your child seem overly anxious or worried?
Does your child struggle with focus or schoolwork?
Does your child express feelings of hopelessness?
Does your child have sudden angry outbursts?
Does your child lose interest in favorite activities?
Does your child talk about harming themselves?

data.title: youth mental health
questions: Do you feel sad or down most of the time?
Do you find it hard to enjoy things you used to like?
Do you feel nervous or scared a lot?
Do you have trouble sleeping or eating normally?
Do you feel alone even when with friends?
Do you get angry or upset easily?
Do you find school or work really hard to handle?
Do you think about hurting yourself?
Do you feel like no one understands you?
Do you feel tired or low-energy all the time?

data.title: postpartum depression
questions: Do you feel overwhelmed as a new or expecting parent?
Have you lost interest in caring for yourself or your baby?
Do you experience sudden mood swings after childbirth?
Do you have trouble sleeping even when your baby is asleep?
Do you feel detached from your baby?
Do you feel guilty about your parenting abilities?
Do you find it hard to bond with your baby?
Do you have thoughts of harming yourself or your baby?
Do you feel isolated from family or friends?
Do you feel hopeless about your future as a parent?

data.title: psychosis schizophrenia
questions: Do you hear voices that others don't hear?
Do you see things that others cannot see?
Do you believe things that others find unbelievable?
Do you feel disconnected from reality?
Do you have trouble distinguishing what's real?
Do you feel suspicious or paranoid about others?
Do you experience confused or disorganized thoughts?
Do you withdraw from social interactions?
Do you have unusual emotional responses?
Do you feel emotions that don't match the situation?

data.title: self-inquiry survey
questions: Do you feel satisfied with your life in general?
Do you find it hard to cope with daily stress?
Do you feel lonely or isolated?
Do you experience frequent mood changes?
Do you feel that you understand your emotions well?
Do you have clear goals that you are working towards?
Do you worry about your personal relationships?
Do you experience physical symptoms due to stress?
Do you find it hard to ask for help when needed?
Do you feel emotionally balanced?

Result.description: This test is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional diagnosis.

Questionnaire.error: An error occurred while analyzing your answers. Please try again.
Questionnaire.title: mental health assessment
Questionnaire.Question: Question
questions: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you felt down, depressed, or hopeless?
How often do you feel nervous, anxious, or on edge?
How often do you find yourself losing interest in activities that used to bring you joy?
Have you been feeling unusually tired or lacking energy even after a good rest?
How often do you struggle with concentrating or making decisions?
How often do you experience feelings of worthlessness or guilt?
Have you had trouble sleeping or have you been sleeping excessively?
How often do you worry excessively about everyday situations?
Do you feel restless or easily irritated?
Have you noticed physical symptoms like headaches or muscle tension due to stress?
Do you experience intrusive thoughts or disturbing worries that are difficult to control?
Have you avoided people, places, or situations that remind you of a traumatic experience?
Do you experience flashbacks or nightmares about a traumatic event?
Do you feel the need to repeatedly perform certain behaviors, like checking or cleaning?
Do you experience sudden mood changes or feel extremely energized at times?

Result.description: This assessment is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional diagnosis.

Header.title: group therapy

data.title: Depression Management
data.description: Share experiences and learn techniques for managing depression.

data.title: Stress Relief Workshop
data.description: Learn practical techniques for managing daily stress and building resilience.

data.title: Shared Experiences
data.description: Connect with others who understand your journey

data.title: Professional Guidance
data.description: Sessions led by licensed mental health professionals

data.title: Safe Environment
data.description: A supportive and confidential space to share and heal

Guidelines.title: session guidelines
data: Arrive 5 minutes before the session starts
Be respectful and supportive of others
Share only what you're comfortable with
Listen actively when others are speaking

Articles.title: mental health conditions
Articles.description: Learn more about different mental health conditions, their symptoms, causes, and treatments.

conditions.title: Depression
conditions.description: A mental disorder characterized by persistent sadness and loss of interest in daily activities.
conditions.definition: A mental disorder characterized by persistent sadness, loss of interest in daily activities, and low energy.
symptoms: Loss of interest in daily activities
Changes in appetite and sleep patterns
causes: Chemical imbalances in the brain (e.g., serotonin deficiency)

conditions.title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)
conditions.description: A disorder characterized by excessive and persistent worry about everyday situations.
conditions.definition: A mental disorder characterized by excessive and persistent worry about everyday situations without a clear reason.
treatment: Relaxation techniques such as meditation and yoga

conditions.title: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
conditions.description: A disorder involving unwanted repetitive thoughts and behaviors.
conditions.definition: A disorder characterized by unwanted repetitive thoughts (obsessions) and repetitive behaviors (compulsions).
symptoms: The need for extreme order and organization
treatment: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (Exposure and Response Prevention - ERP)

conditions.title: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
conditions.description: A disorder that develops after exposure to traumatic events.
conditions.definition: A disorder that develops after exposure to a traumatic event such as war, assault, or accidents.
symptoms: Avoidance of trauma-related places or people
Hypervigilance and strong reactions to triggers

conditions.title: Schizophrenia
conditions.description: A severe mental disorder affecting thinking, perception, and behavior.
conditions.definition: A severe mental disorder that affects thinking, perception, and behavior.

conditions.title: Bipolar Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder characterized by extreme mood swings including mania and depression.
conditions.definition: A mental disorder characterized by extreme mood swings, including episodes of mania and depression.
symptoms: Manic episodes (high energy, reduced sleep, excessive confidence)

conditions.title: Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD)
conditions.description: A disorder involving emotional instability and unstable relationships.
conditions.definition: A personality disorder characterized by emotional instability, unstable relationships, and impulsive behavior.

conditions.title: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
conditions.description: A neurodevelopmental disorder affecting focus and impulse control.
conditions.definition: A neurodevelopmental disorder affecting focus, impulse control, and hyperactivity.

conditions.title: Eating Disorders
conditions.description: Disorders related to unhealthy eating behaviors and body image.
conditions.definition: Disorders related to unhealthy eating behaviors, such as anorexia nervosa and bulimia nervosa.
symptoms: Loss of control over eating habits
causes: Societal pressure and body image expectations

conditions.title: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)
conditions.description: A developmental disorder affecting communication and social interactions.
conditions.definition: A developmental disorder affecting communication and social interactions.
symptoms: Difficulty with eye contact and social communication

conditions.title: Panic Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder involving sudden and repeated panic attacks.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving sudden and repeated panic attacks.
symptoms: Chest pain and shortness of breath

conditions.title: Social Anxiety Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder characterized by intense fear of social situations.
conditions.definition: A disorder characterized by intense fear of social situations.
symptoms: Physical symptoms like sweating or blushing

conditions.title: Specific Phobias
conditions.description: A disorder involving intense fear of specific objects or situations.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving intense fear of specific objects or situations.

conditions.title: Dissociative Identity Disorder (DID)
conditions.description: A disorder involving a disconnection from reality and multiple identities.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving a disconnection from reality and multiple identities.

conditions.title: Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD)
conditions.description: A type of depression related to seasonal changes.
conditions.definition: A type of depression related to seasonal changes.

conditions.title: Substance Use Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder involving the harmful use of substances like drugs or alcohol.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving the harmful use of substances like drugs or alcohol.
symptoms: Loss of control over substance use

conditions.title: Insomnia Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
conditions.definition: A disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.

conditions.title: Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD)
conditions.description: A severe form of PMS affecting mood and physical health.
conditions.definition: A severe form of PMS affecting mood and physical health.

conditions.title: Hoarding Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder involving excessive accumulation of items.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving excessive accumulation of items.
symptoms: Distress at the thought of throwing things away

conditions.title: Adjustment Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder caused by difficulty coping with a stressful life event.
conditions.definition: A disorder caused by difficulty coping with a stressful life event.
causes: Major life changes (e.g., divorce, job loss)

podcasts.title: The Mental Illness Happy Hour
podcasts.description: A weekly online podcast where comedians, artists, and regular folks share their experiences with mental illness.

podcasts.title: Therapy Chat Podcast
podcasts.description: Conversations about trauma, attachment, and mindfulness with Laura Reagan, LCSW-C.

podcasts.title: The Happiness Lab with Dr. Laurie Santos
podcasts.description: You might think you know what it takes to lead a happier lifeâ€¦ more money, a better job, or Instagram-worthy vacations. You're dead wrong.

podcasts.title: Mindful Muslim Podcast
podcasts.description: A podcast that aims to explore and discuss mental health and well-being from an Islamic perspective.

podcasts.title: Feel Better, Live More with Dr. Rangan Chatterjee
podcasts.description: A podcast that aims to inspire, empower and transform the way we feel.

podcasts.title: The Anxiety Coaches Podcast
podcasts.description: A podcast for anyone struggling with anxiety, panic attacks, stress, and depression.

podcasts.title: The Trauma Therapist Podcast
podcasts.description: A podcast about the human spirit. Hosted by Guy Macpherson, PhD.

podcasts.title: The Mental Health Foundation Podcast
podcasts.description: A series of podcasts from the Mental Health Foundation exploring mental health issues.

Footer.description: We're committed to deliver life-changing mental care to everyone who needs it.
